Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Chemoradiotherapy Combined with Local Excision for T1 to T2 Low Rectal Cancer

Participants.evidence: patients aged 20-75 years with T1N0 or T2N0 low rectal cancer, confirmed by MRI, CT, proctoscopy, and digital rectal examination

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved LE followed by CRT (45 Gy external beam irradiation and 5-week intravenous 5-fluorouracil).

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the efficacy of chemoradiotherapy (CRT) combined with local excision (LE) in treating T1 to T2 low rectal cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was 5-year disease-free survival (DFS).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Fifty-seven patients were treated, with 53 having T1 lesions and 4 having T2 lesions.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 5-year DFS was 94% for T1 lesions and 75% for T2 lesions.

Harms.evidence: No serious, nontransient treatment-related complications were reported.
